intro: Lithocardium sebestana, commonly known as the stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in dry conditions. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and can be found in various parts of Europe and Asia. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms in the spring. Lithocardium sebestana is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
